items.name: The Cream Ale
items.desc: The Cream Ale (4.5%) - An American style, from the pre-prohibition era, remastered for London today. The Cream Ale, brewed exclusively with Loral hops, delivers floral, herbal and bright citrus aromas. It gets its name and its smooth character from the use of flaked corn and oats. All of this combines to create an easy drinking, refreshing beer.

items.name: The IPA
items.desc: The IPA (6.0%) - India Pale Ales were born in 18th century Britain. The style has since been on a journey of development and diversification. Our IPA is inspired by those from the West Coast of America. Brewed in London with British malt and American hops (Summit, Ekuanot & Enigma), it is dank, resinous and fruit forward. Store cold and drink fresh. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Lager
items.desc: The Lager (4.7%) - Inspired by the Helles Lagerbiers of Munich, this is a true London Lager. German malts, European hops and London water come together to produce a smooth, crisp and flavourful beer. In the spirit of Das Reinheitsgebot, we use the spunding method to carbonate our lager naturally; while an extended cold storage in Lager tanks gives our beer time to condition and mature as all true lagers must. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Lemons & The Limes
items.summary: Anspach & Hobday X Affinity Brew Co
items.desc: Anspach & Hobday X Affinity Brew Co - The Lemons & The Limes - 4.6% - Brewed in collaboration with our good friends Affinity Brew Co, The Lemons & The Limes draws inspiration from our Bermondsey neighbours zested saison, Breeze. We took a classic German style Hefeweizen and infused it with lemon and lime zest during the whirlpool. The bright citrus notes lift the wheat beer, keeping it light, fresh, and incredibly drinkable. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Ordinary Bitter
items.desc: The Ordinary Bitter (3.7%) - The original session beer, Ordinary Bitters formed a cornerstone of English drinking culture. Perfectly balanced between malt sweetness and hop bitterness, our interpretation is brought up to date with the use of US Chinook hops. Delicate hop aromas of pine, spice and dark fruits are followed by a smooth, full bodied palate with notes of biscuit and caramel. Brewed with EKG and Chinook. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Pale Ale
items.desc: The Pale Ale (4.4%) - Pale Ales are the mainstay of todayâ€™s craft brewing scene, but they date back to the 1700s, when innovation led to the production of new and paler malts. Our interpretation brings the style bang up to date, pairing a crisp malt base with fresh American hops. Light, bright & fruity, The Pale Ale is our ultimate drinking beer. Brewed with Citra, Mosaic and Simcoe. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Patersbier
items.desc: The Patersbier (3.7%) - Perhaps the original Table Beer, Patersbiers are low ABV Abbey-Style ales first produced by monastic breweries. Often brewed exclusively for the monks, the Father's tipple is a light, fresh, easy-drinking beer designed to quench thirst and nourish the soul. Classic 'Belgian' characteristics are present yet subtle on the nose, complemented by the soft, fruity and herbal aromas of Citra and Loral Hops. Light, dry and fresh, The Patersbier is the perfect every-day drinking beer. These cans are 440ml.

items.name: The Porter
items.desc:
The beer that started it all.
The Porter (6.7%) - The Porter is our flagship beer. The style established Victorian London as the centre of the brewing world. The Porter is also the beer that started us on our journey. Our blend of highly kilned and roasted malts is suited perfectly to our water, producing balanced flavours of rich coffee and dark chocolate. This award-winning Porter represents the true beer style of London. It is one that we are incredibly proud of. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Sour Dry Hop
items.desc: The Sour Dry Hop (4.9%) - The Sour Dry Hop is the perfect balance of Old and New World brewing. Inspired by the traditional Berliner Weisse, a sour beer once brewed in Berlin and known as the 'Champagne of the North'. Ours is soured by Lactobacillus and dry-hopped with Citra. An unusual style that delivers a tart, citrusy fruitiness. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Table Blonde
items.desc:
The Table Blonde (3.2%) - Our first Belgian-style in a can, and a Webstore & Taproom exclusive! The Table Blonde is a light, fresh Belgian style Blonde Ale brewed to a lower ABV to keep things sessionable.
Typical ester and phenolic aromas dominate the nose with notes of banana and spice. The hops bring gentle fruit and herbal flavours to the palate, while the low bitterness leads to a smooth finish. A short stint in our horizontal conditioning tanks rounds the beer out, resulting in a well balanced, characterful Belgian influenced Table Beer. These are 440ml cans.
